Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one land habitat and one water habitat.
The student can include a variety of plants in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, or flowering plants.
The student can include a variety of animals in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants in the land habitat, and fish, clams in the water habitat.
The student can compare and label common and different types of living things found in each habitat.
The student can show patterns by highlighting the diversity of plant and animal life in each habitat.
